Method Detail

getPearsonCorrelation

public static double getPearsonCorrelation(double[] x,
                                           double[] y)
Returns the Pearson correlation coefficient of the 2 sets of values. Each array should be the same length and contain at least 3 values. 
    x = sample values in the first set
    y = sample values in the second set
    n = number of values in each set
    Sx = standard deviation of x
    Sy = standard deviation of y
 
                                               _              _
                     sum( i=0 to n-1, ( x[i] - x ) * ( y[i] - y ))
 correlationValue = -----------------------------------------------
                                ( n - 1 ) Sx * Sy
 
 References:
 Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia (2010, April 13).
     Correlation and Dependence.
     Retrieved April 14, 2010, from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Correlation#Pearson.27s_product-moment_coefficient

Parameters:
x - The first set of values to use for the calculation.
y - The second set of values to use for the calculation.
Returns:
The Pearson correlation value.

getSpearmanCorrelation

public static double getSpearmanCorrelation(double[] x,
                                            double[] y)
Returns the Spearman rank correlation coefficient of the 2 sets of data. Each array should be the same length and contain at least 3 values. 
    x = values in the first set
    y = values in the second set
    n = number of values in each set
    Rx = rank array of x, ie. the new locations of each element of x if x were sorted
    Ry = rank array of y, ie. the new locations of each element of y if y were sorted
 
                         6 * sum( i=0 to n-1, ( Rx[i] - Ry[i] )^2 )
 correlationValue = 1 - --------------------------------------------
                                       n * ( n^2 - 1 )
 
 References: 
 Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia (2010, April 1). 
     Spearman's rank correlation coefficient. 
     Retrieved April 14, 2010, from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spearman's_rank_correlation_coefficient
 Spiegel, Murray R. (1961). Statistics, 2nd Edition (pp 376,391-393). New York.

Parameters:
x - The first set of data to use for the calculation.
y - The second set of data to use for the calculation.
Returns:
The Spearman correlation value.

getKendallCorrelation

public static double getKendallCorrelation(double[] x,
                                           double[] y)
Returns the Kendall tau rank correlation coefficient of the 2 sets of data. Each array should be the same length and contain at least 3 values. 
    x = values in the first set
    y = values in the second set
    n = number of values in each set
    Rx = the rank of the values in the first set
    Ry = the rank of the values in the second set
    Tx = the number of ties in x.
    Ty = the number of ties in y.
    concordant = The number of concordant pairs
    discordant = The number of discordant pairs

                                 concordant - discordant
 correlationValue = ---------------------------------------------
                              n*(n-1)            n*(n-1)         
                     sqrt( ( ------- - Tx ) * (  ------- - Ty ) )
                                2                   2            

 References:
 Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia (2010, March 25). 
     Kendall tau rank correlation coefficient. 
     Retrieved April 14, 2010, from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kendall_tau_rank_correlation_coefficient

Parameters:
x - The first set of data to use for the calculation.
y - The second set of data to use for the calculation.
Returns:
The Kendall tau correlation value.

getRank

public static double[] getRank(double[] list)
Finds the rank of each element in an array.

Parameters:
list - The arrayList to get the rank of.
Returns:
An array containing the rank order of each element.

minRegular

public static double minRegular(double[] values)
Returns the minimum regular value in a data set. This is the smallest value that would not be considered an outlier.

Parameters:
values - The set of values to find the minimum regular value for.
Returns:
The minimum regular value.

maxRegular

public static double maxRegular(double[] values)
Returns the maximum regular value in a data set. This is the largest value that would not be considered an outlier.

Parameters:
values - The set of values to find the maximum regular value for.
Returns:
The minimum regular value.

regularRange

public static Range regularRange(double[] values)
Finds the range inside which all regular values fall (inclusive).

Parameters:
values - The set of data to find the regular range for.
Returns:
A range outside which all other values in the data set would be considered outliers.

quartileRange

Parameters:
values - The set of data to find the quartile range for.
Returns:
A range containing the 25th to 75th percentiles.
